fields.value: Number of scientific publications (peer-reviewed articles) published in academic journals

dsDescriptionValue.value: These indicators monitor scientific outcomes in the form of publications along innovation areas. The insights contained in them may help the understanding of societal challenges, contribute to the emergence of future technological or social innovations, or help to improve enabling conditions. We present the number of scientific peer-reviewed publications in the Web of Science database. Publications represent research activity in specific countries, which in turn makes entrepreneurial activities and investment more likely. Similar publication and investment patterns hint at the presence of learning networks between firms and universities. As we only track English-language publications in Web of Science indexed journals, some increases in publications may be due to the increased pressure to publish in such journals rather than to an actual increase in the productivity of a country’s researchers in the respective field. Countries that put a higher emphasis on publications in their native language may underperform according to these metrics. English-speaking countries or those where English is more dominant are likely to perform better with this metric.

files.description: Web of Science (WoS) advanced search for each ERA country: WoS database is queried for publications containing at least one of the following keywords in the Topic field (TS), which includes Title, Abstract, and Keywords. Country identification is queried through "Affiliation" (AD) of the publications to each ERA country. The outcome is a time series of number of related publications for each ERA country (34 countries). Different clusters of research topics have been defined in order to develop different indicators regarding scientific publications. The aim is to show and assess trends in RECREATE-related research strands, such as the ones defined below. Related keywords: “bioenergy", "biogas", "sustainable biomass", "second generation biofuel", "2nd*generation biofuel", "second generation biorefinery", "2nd*generation biorefinery", "second generation" and "biofuel", "second generation" and "biorefiner*", "biotechnolog*", "bio$economy", "biopolym*", "bio$plastic", "bio-based industr*"
files.label: Bio-basedIndustries_Publications.tab

files.description: Web of Science (WoS) advanced search for each ERA country: WoS database is queried for publications containing at least one of the following keywords in the Topic field (TS), which includes Title, Abstract, and Keywords. Country identification is queried through "Affiliation" (AD) of the publications to each ERA country. The outcome is a time series of number of related publications for each ERA country (34 countries). Furthermore, the overall number of publications has been weighted by the number of inhabitants (retrieved from Eurostat). Related keywords: TS=("low*carbon energ*" or ((“coal” or “natural gas” or “oil” or “petrol” or “combustion”) not (biogas” OR “biofuel”)) and (“efficiency”)
files.label: FossilFuelEfficiency_Publications.tab
